intro: Polygala vulgaris f. annua, commonly known as the common milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
